alert.note: Alert for Daviess (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 27 at 11:26AM EST until March 05 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Kentucky...Illinois... Ohio River at Owensboro, Newburgh Dam, Mount Vernon, J.T. Myers Dam, Shawneetown, and Golconda. .Water levels continue to rise along the Ohio River from Owensboro to Golconda. Crests in minor to moderate flood stage are forecast to occur early to mid week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at Owensboro. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:06 AM CST Sunday the stage was 39.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 40.5 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday evening. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
